OFFICE MEMORANDUM No. PHDR-97-20
To : ALL PERSONNEL CONCERNED
Subject: SERVICE RECOGNITION INCENTIVE (SRI) FOR FISCAL YEAR 2020
Date : 22 December 2020 _________________________________________________________________________
1. Please be informed that all eligible faculty members and non-academic employees will receive a service recognition incentive of not exceeding ₱10,000.00.
2. The grant shall be subjected to the conditions stipulated under AO 37 Section 2 and its exclusion under AO 37 Section 3, to wit;
a. Eligible to receive the SRI are the following: • Civilian personnel occupying regular, contractual or casual positions; • Personnel who are still in government services as of 30 November 2020; • Personnel who have rendered at lease a total or an aggregate of four (4) months of satisfactory service as of 30 November 2020, inclusive of services rendered under any of the alternative work arrangements prescribed by the Civil Service Commission; • Personnel who have rendered less than a total of an aggregate of four (4) months of satisfactory service as of 30 November 2020 shall be entitled to a pro-rated share of the SRI, as follows:
Length of Service Percentage of the Incentive 3 months but less than 4 months 40% 2 months but less than 3 months 30% 1 month but less than2 months 20% Less than 1 month 10%
b. Excluded from the grant of SRI:
• Consultants and experts engaged for a limited period to perform specific activities or services with expected outputs; • Laborers engaged through job contracts (pakyaw) and those paid on piecework basis; • Student workers and apprentices; and • Individuals and groups of people whose services are engaged through job orders, contracts o service and other similarly situated.
3. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
4. Thank you.
DR. HERNANDO D. ROBLES. CEO VI President
(046) 4150-010 / (046) 4150-011 email: office.president@cvsu.edu.ph

OFFICE OF THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR RESEARCH AND EXTENSION
03 October 2022
PROF. GIL D. RAMOS Campus Administrator CvSU Tanza Campus
Dear Prof. Ramos,
Good day!
The Office of the Vice President for Research and Extension is currently conducting its Research and Extension Caravan among the different colleges and campuses of the university. The said caravan is a knowledge-sharing and learning caravan in the academic units of the university in order to get input from the different colleges and campuses of the university as we formulate a new Research and Extension Agenda for 2023-2028.
Moreover, it aims to raise awareness in our academic units on the available facilities and equipment they may use in the conduct of research and extension, and identify the research and extension initiatives, concerns, and other input from academic units of colleges and campuses.
In line with this, we would like to schedule a forum on your campus on October 26, 2022, from 2:00 p.m. -4:00 p.m. May we also request your good office the data on the allocation of funds for research and extension activities of your campus for 2023 and the budget utilization for 2021 on or before October 25, 2022.
We are hoping for your positive response to this endeavor. Thank you and we look forward to working with you.
Respectfully yours,
MELBOURNE R. TALACTAC, Ph.D. Vice President
Innovating Knowledge, Improving Lives, Globalizing Impact
